summary: Email exchange between Audrey Strauss and an unnamed prosecutor discussing the successful indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell, praising the team's work on both the Epstein and Maxwell cases, and referencing efforts to address past government failures in handling the case.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.role: Acting U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Praises the prosecution team for their work on the Epstein and Maxwell cases and discusses scheduling a team celebration.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referenced as the subject of a new indictment following the Epstein prosecution.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced in relation to the initial prosecution and the crimes committed with Maxwell.

connections.description: Described as having committed wrongs together, with Maxwell's indictment following the Epstein prosecution.
Supervisory relationship where Strauss praises the prosecutor's team for their work on the Epstein and Maxwell cases.

events.title: Indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Audrey Strauss announces the indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell, crediting the prosecution team's work.

events.title: Prosecutor's Response to Strauss
events.description: An unnamed prosecutor thanks Strauss for her support and references positive feedback from victim's counsel about addressing past wrongs.

keyFacts: The document reveals internal DOJ praise for the team that indicted Ghislaine Maxwell, following the Jeffrey Epstein case.
A victim's counsel is quoted stating the prosecution helped to 'right two wrongs': the original crimes and the government's initial failure to properly address them.
The correspondence highlights ongoing investigation into 'other individuals' beyond Maxwell.
The team faced 'byzantine legal issues' and 'challenges with various witnesses' during the investigation.
